reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Effective HIV and TB control project in the Kyrgyz Republic

description.narrative: Kyrgyzstan - TB/HIV - United Nations Development Programme - UNDP Kyrgyzstan. This program has the following goals: To minimize the impact of the HIV epidemic by reducing 50% of the incidence and mortality by 2023 compared to 2015, as a stage towards eliminating the epidemic in the Kyrgyz Republic by 2030.. Success of treatment among drug resistant forms of MDR-TB by 2023, 75% according to NTP-5.. The objectives of this program are: Reduce the number of new HIV infections, especially among key populations by 70% by 2023 compared to 2015.. Ensure that 90% of people living with HIV (PLHIV) are aware of their HIV status.. Cover 90% of people living with HIV with antiretroviral therapy (ART) and achieve viral load suppression in 90% of people receiving ART by 2023.. Achieve a reduction to less than 2% of mother-to-child transmission of HIV, which will lead to its elimination by 2021.. To reduce the level of stigma and discrimination to zero in government organizations providing HIV-related services to key populations and PLHIV.. Reduce to zero the number of laws, other regulations and practices that discriminate against people living with HIV and key populations.. Ensure coordination and sustainable financing of HIV response measures by gradually increasing the share of government funding for HIV prevention and treatment programs to 60% by 2023.. To ensure universal access to timely and quality diagnosis and treatment of all forms of TB including M/XDR-TB

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for KGZ-C-UNDP
Percentage of HIV-positive registered TB patients given anti-retroviral therapy during TB treatment

MDR TB-other 2: Number of MDR/XDR/RR-TB patients on treatment receiving patient support (food, hygiene packages, money allowances) for better adherence to treatment- includes inpatient and outpatient treatment
Percentage of HIV-positive women who received ART during pregnancy and/or labour and delivery
Percentage of individuals receiving Opioid Substitution Therapy who received treatment for at least 6 months
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
Percentage of adults and children that initiated ART, with an undetectable viral load at 12 months (<1000 copies/ml)
KP-other 1: Percentage of PWID prisoners reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
TCS-other 1: Number of PLHIV reached with community care and support programme
Percentage of HIV-positive pregnant women who received antiretrovirals to reduce the risk of mother-to-child transmission
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
Percentage of people who inject drugs reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART, who have a suppressed viral load at 12 months (<1000 copies/ml)
Percentage of MSM reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
MDR TB-other 3: Percentage and number of patients with symptoms or signs suggestive for TB examined by Xpert MTB/RIF methodology and confirmed with active TB
Percentage of HIV-positive patients who were screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings
Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy
Percentage of other vulnerable populations that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of people living with HIV initiated on ART who are screened for TB in HIV treatment settings
Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Number of needles and syringes distributed per person who injects drugs per year by needle and syringe programs
RLB-other 1: Number of documented key affected population human rights violations (desegregated by KAP groups)
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
Percentage of TB patients with DST result for at least Rifampicin among the total number of notified (new and retreatment) cases in the same year
Percentage of MSM that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
KP-other 1: Percentage of other vulnerable populations that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results (prisoners)
Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of people on ART among all people living with HIV at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of people who inject drugs that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of confirmed MDR-TB cases tested for susceptibility to any fluoroquinolone and any second-line injectable drug
Number of people in prisons or other closed settings that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of people newly diagnosed with HIV initiated on ART
Percentage of men who have sex with men that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Number of cases of XDR TB enrolled on treatment
Percentage of new HIV-positive patients starting IPT during the reporting period
Percentage of previously treated TB patients receiving DST (bacteriologically positive cases only)
Percentage of infants born to HIV-positive women receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth
Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
Percentage of confirmed RR/MDR-TB cases tested for resistance to second-line drugs
Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status
Impact indicator for KGZ-C-UNDP
Percentage of people who inject drugs who are living with HIV
RR-TB and/or MDR-TB prevalence among new TB patients: Proportion of new TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB
Number of AIDS-related deaths per 100,000 population
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
Percentage of men who have sex with men who are living with HIV
TB I-Other 1: RR-TB and or MDR/TB prevalence among previously treated TB patients: Proportion of previously treated TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
Outcome indicator for KGZ-C-UNDP
Percentage of people living with HIV who know their HIV status at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of people living with HIV who report experiences of HIV-related discrimination in health-care settings
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
Percentage of people diagnosed with TB who report stigma in community settings that inhibited them from seeking and accessing TB services
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART who are virologically suppressed
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a non regular partner
Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Percentage of adults and children with HIV, known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy
Case notification rate per 100,000 population- bacteriologically-confirmed TB, new and relapse
Percentage of people who inject drugs reporting the use of sterile injecting equipment the last time they injected
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a male partner
Treatment success rate - bacteriologically confirmed TB cases
Percentage of sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client
